title: Magnetic fields - compass in magnetic fields

content.question: Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> shows a uniform magnetic field directed toward the bottom of the page and Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> shows a uniform magnetic field directed toward the top of the page. A small magnetic compass is also shown. The shaded end of the compass needle is a north magnetic pole. Which of the following correctly describes the orientation of the compass when the compass is moved into each magnetic field?

choices.label: In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the shaded end the compass needle will point toward the top of the page and in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> the shaded end of the compass needle will point toward the bottom of the page.

In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the shaded end of the compass needle will point toward the bottom of the page and in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> the shaded end the compass needle will point toward the top of the page.

In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the shaded end of the compass needle will point to the right and in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> the shaded end of the compass needle will point to the left.

In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the shaded end of the compass needle will point to the left and in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> the shaded end of the compass needle will point to the right.

content.answer: In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the shaded end of the compass needle will point toward the bottom of the page and in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> the shaded end the compass needle will point toward the top of the page.
